dashboard.description:
# Business applications
The "business applications" score rates the ability of the employees to open and use business applications (excluding the productivity and collaboration tools) smoothly and with good response times. Business apps can be web or desktop-based.
The score is based on the following hard metrics retrieved from the endpoints: * Crashes * Freezes * Connectivity * Network response time
:::configuration * In the Finder, edit the categories "DEX - Binary" and "DEX - Domains" to add the [executables](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=DEX%20-%20Binary&Type=binary) and [domains](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=DEX%20-%20Domain&Type=domain) of the business applications that you wish to monitor (WebApp0, WebApp1, DesktopApp0, DesktopApp1, etc.). Do not rename the keywords, edit exclusively the auto-tagging conditions. * In the Portal, edit the *Business applications* dashboard to rename the labels (Web App 0, Web App 1, Desktop App 0, Desktop App 1, etc.) with the actual names of the applications you chose. :::
:::tip The widget *Number of devices with issues* lists the devices which have a score considered as being an average or poor experience (i.e., a score lower than 7). Hover the mouse over the area of interest and click *Show details* to drill down for the score details. :::
dashboard.name: Business applications

dashboard.description:
# Device
The "device" score rates the ability of the employee to start and use a device smoothly and with good response times.
It is based on the employees' sentiments as collected with Nexthink Engage and on the following hard metrics retrieved from the endpoints: * Overall number of application crashes and freezes * Boot speed * Number of blue screens of death (BSODs) * Device responsiveness (memory usage, CPU usage, IO and number of pages faults) * Number of hard resets * Impact of agents running on the device (crashes, freezes & high CPU usage) * Logon duration * Free space in the system disk
:::configuration In the Finder, edit the category "DEX - Agents" to add the [executables](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=DEX%20-%20Agents&Type=binary) of the agents you would like to measure the impact on the devices. Add keywords for each new group of agents. :::
:::tip The widget *Number of devices with issues* lists the devices which have a score considered as being an average or poor experience (most of the time, this means a score lower than 7). Hover the mouse over the area of interest and click *Show details* to drill down for the score details. :::
dashboard.name: Device

dashboard.description:
# Employee sentiment
The Employee Sentiment Score rates the feelings and perceptions of the employees when interacting with the overall IT environment (workplace, processes, people).
It is based on the answers to a questionnaire sent to your employees.
dashboard.name: Employee sentiment

metric.label: Access restrictions to documents, apps, etc.

dashboard.description:
# Overview The Digital Experience Score measures the digital employee experience, defined as the ability of an employee to get things done by interacting with the IT environment in an enjoyable manner.
The score is based on: * Hard data retrieved by the Collector * Sentiment data collected with a Nexthink Engage campaign
By combining hard and sentiment data, the Digital Experience Score assesses the following key aspects of the digital employee experience: * Business applications * Device * Productivity and collaboration * Employee sentiment
:::tip More information on how the score is computed can be found [here](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/GlossaryAndReferences/ComputationoftheDEXscore). :::
Version 2.0.1.0

dashboard.description:
# Productivity & collaboration
The "productivity & collaboration" score rates the ability of the employees to start and use the corporate productivity & collaboration applications (e.g., Office suite, corporate browser, etc.) smoothly and with good response times.
The score is based on the employees' sentiment as collected with Nexthink Engage and on the following hard metrics retrieved from the endpoints: * Crashes * Freezes * Connectivity * Network response time * Application startup time
:::configuration * Make sure that your internal networks and domains are properly specified in the Web Console as explained [here](https://doc.nexthink.com/Documentation/Nexthink/latest/InstallationAndConfiguration/Specifyingyourinternalnetworksanddomains). * In the Finder, edit the categories "DEX - Binary" and "DEX - Domains" to edit the [executables](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=DEX%20-%20Binary&Type=binary) and [domains](nxt://Edit-NxCategory?Encoding=Url&Name=DEX%20-%20Domain&Type=domain) with your corporate Office suite applications. Do not rename the keywords, edit exclusively the auto-tagging conditions. * In the Portal, edit the *Productivity & collaboration* dashboard to rename the labels (Email client, Spreadsheet solution, etc.) with the actual names of the applications your company has. :::
:::tip The widget *Number of devices with issues* lists the devices which have a score considered as being an average or poor experience (i.e., a score lower than 7). Hover the mouse over the area of interest and click *Show details* to drill down for the score details. :::
dashboard.name: Productivity & collaboration
